title: Antique
content:
Hi, been a while since I posted. Came back for some help.

I'm working on a logo and stationary for a bespoke furniture maker and he has the idea for the logo. It's based on some free font he found that mixes up the faces to look like some sort of ransom letter made up of different old display faces.  
I'm trying to re-work it using models of old types found on the manufacturers marks/plates/stamps foung on old furniture and antiques. If anyone could help out with images, leads, ideas or just a good source of unusual or archaic typrfaces that would be perfect. Much appreciated.

Cheers, James.
author: james j eden

comments.content:
[Some pages from Alphabets Old & New, published in 1910](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020155132/http:/community.livejournal.com/ru_typography/505224.html#cutid1)

[Old Type Specimens Books at the Open Library (scans)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020155132/http:/opentype.info/blog/2008/02/18/type-specimen/)

Hope these help.
